channel.title: physics.gen-ph updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: physics.gen-ph updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: An examination of the de Sitter space dual to the Monster conformal field theory
item.description: arXiv:2309.09762v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In 2001, in an examination of the quantum gravity in de Sitter space, Witten argued that the absence of a classical de Sitter limit suggests that the possible values of the dimension of the Hilbert space in string/M-theory are 'sporadic', rather than arising from 'infinite families'. Later in 2007, he proposed that the Monster CFT is very likely the dual CFT of 3D pure gravity in Anti-de Sitter space. The finite dimension of the Hilbert space in dS space limits the number of elements/microscopic DOF in the ground state, and therefore, determines its energy scale in Planck units. Inspired by Witten's contributions, we assume the existence of a dS space whose dimension of the Hilbert space is determined by the Monster CFT and calculate its vacuum energies. In such a dS space, it is observed that the closed string mass of the underlying scalar field is 125.4 GeV, and the scale of its quadratic field extension, in the twisted sector, is close to the cosmological constant. A few explanations and discussion of the implications are offered.
item.dc:creator: Seyed Khaki
